edu.depaul.armada.service

Interface MetricService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MetricServiceImpl

    public interface MetricService
    An interface which specifies methods used for storing and receiving Container metrics over time.
    Author:
    ptrzyna

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  MetricService.ContainerState 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Metric> getContainerCount(int periodInHours)
      Gives us counts over time of how many containers were running NOTE: for each hourly interval we will count how many containers are running Example of returned data: 1am {count:3}
      java.util.List<ThresholdMetric> getMetrics(int periodInHours)
      Gives us counts over time of how containers behaved NOTE: for each hourly interval we will count how many containers breached a threshold Example of returned data: 1am {up:3, error:4, warn:7}, 2am ...

    • Method Detail

      • getMetrics

        java.util.List<ThresholdMetric> getMetrics(int periodInHours)
        Gives us counts over time of how containers behaved NOTE: for each hourly interval we will count how many containers breached a threshold Example of returned data: 1am {up:3, error:4, warn:7}, 2am ...
        Parameters:
        periodInHours - how far back do we want to get data (each data point is for an hour interval)
        Returns:
        list of counts for a 24h period

      • getContainerCount

        java.util.List<Metric> getContainerCount(int periodInHours)
        Gives us counts over time of how many containers were running NOTE: for each hourly interval we will count how many containers are running Example of returned data: 1am {count:3}
        Parameters:
        periodInHours - how far back do we want to get data (each data point is for an hour interval)
        Returns:
        list of counts for a 24h period
